featured.text: Everyone starts and ends the day by howling to check out where their nearest competitors are.
They are the loudest land animal and their howls can be heard three miles away through dense forests.
Interestingly, when there are few howler monkeys in an area, the howling routine takes on a different pattern.
Why do the keepers at the sanctuary use recorded howls? (A) To prevent the howler monkeys from getting homesick.

other.text: According to the passage, which of the following is true about howler monkeys? (A) They howl most often at noon.
Why did the howler monkeys in Belize howl less often?

definition.en_def: A long, loud, mournful cry, especially one made by a wolf or dog.
definition.example: The wolf began to howl at the moon.
